title: Work - compare work from force position graph

content.question: How do <math alttext="W sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>W</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math> and <math alttext="W sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> compare, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub 1 is less than W sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because the area under the curve of Force <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> over the region <math alttext="0 less than x, less than 1 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math> is smaller than the area under the curve of Force <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> over the same region.

<math alttext="W sub 1 is less than W sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because at the midpoint, <math alttext="x equals 0.5 meter" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>, the value of Force <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is less than the value of Force <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

<math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than W sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because the maximum value of Force <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is greater than the maximum value of Force <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

<math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than W sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because the slope of Force <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>’s graph increases, while the slope of Force <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>’s graph decreases.

content.answer: <math alttext="W sub 1 is less than W sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because the area under the curve of Force <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> over the region <math alttext="0 less than x, less than 1 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math> is smaller than the area under the curve of Force <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> over the same region.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
